title: Dogged By Scandal, DC Incumbent Goes Down In Primary
teaser: The incumbent mayor of the nation's capital will not be re-elected. A federal investigation into Vincent Gray's 2010 campaign, along with allegations lodged just weeks before the election, helped propel his closest opponent to a surprise double-digit victory in the Democratic primary.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
